俀字的基本解释

俀
tuǐ
软弱。

俀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuǐ］
［《集韻》吐猥切，上賄，透。］
弱。又春秋时鲁宣公名。《史记·魯周公世家》：“次妃敬嬴，嬖愛，生子俀。”裴駰集解引徐广曰：“一作'倭'。”一说俀音同倭。司马贞索隐：“倭音人唯反，一作'俀'，音同。”

俀字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　俀； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页104第01
【集韻】吐猥切，音腿。弱也。【篇海】舊音妥。

俀字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
俀字的起名意思

暂无。

Sing
Basic explanation of words
Sing
tuǐ
weak.
Sing
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuǐ］
["Ji Yun" vomiting and cutting, bribery, thorough. ]
weak. Lu Xuan's public name was in the Spring and Autumn Period. "Historical Records: Family of Lu Zhougong": "The second concubine respects Ying, loves her, and gives birth to a child." Pei Qi quoted Xu Guang and said: "One is a'wo'." One said that the pronunciation is the same as that of a widow. Sima Zhensuoyin: "The Japanese people are only opposites, and they have the same pronunciation."
Sing
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [The Department of Human Characters] 　俀; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 104 01
[Jiyun] Tuyu cut, tone legs. Weak too. [Pianhai] The old sound is good.
